comments.body: is this necessary? get_handle i believe does this already

I think it is.
[`get_handle` calls `infer_compression` only when `path_or_buffer` is a string](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/master/pandas/io/common.py#L388-L389).
So if we hand over a buffer, `compression` stays as "infer", and later on, [it'll raise ValueError if the compression is not "gzip", "bz2", "zip", nor "xz".](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/master/pandas/io/common.py#L391-L433)

Please advise what's the best here, thank you!
Is the S3 or GCS restriction still accurate? You seem to have tests for general `http://` URLs.

I made `read_pickle` accept general URLs just because [`get_filepath_or_buffer` can send GET request to the URL using `urllib.request.urlopen()` (but only GET request)](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/master/pandas/io/common.py#L171-L179).
My test only checks `read_pickle` for now.

I can update `to_pikle` so that it'll send a POST request, please advise if it's better.
Understood. We can handle that elsewhere.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@
        .. versionchanged:: 1.0.0
           Accept URL. URL has to be of S3 or GCS.

    compression : {'infer', 'gzip', 'bz2', 'zip', 'xz', None}, default 'infer'

comments.body: is there a reason to move this inside the "try"?

actually, I didn’t move this to inside the try. It is still outside the same`try` as it was before (semantically).

What I did in order to catch `UnicodeDecodeError` only once was to wrap all that code in an outer `try` block that catches `UnicodeDecodeError` regardless if is thrown by `pickle.load(f)` or by `pc.load(f, encoding=none)`.

So, in summary, it’s not that I moved the `excs_to_catch` to inside the `try`, but that I changed the scope of the `UnicodeDecodeError` `try` block to include that inner try.
